snippet: In 1776, Nathan Hale’s only regret was that he had but one life to lose for his country. But if he could see what has become of the statue of him that sits in City Hall Park, he might find it all, at the very least, a bit unfortunate.
abstract: In 1776, Nathan Hale’s only regret was that he had but one life to lose for his country. But if he could see what has become of the statue of him that sits in City Hall Park, he might find it all, at the very least, a bit unfortunate.

byline.original: By JACKEE BUDESTA BATANDA and ANDY NEWMAN

headline.main: For Nathan Hale, Perhaps Another Regret
headline.print_headline: For a Shackled Patriot, Perhaps Another Regret
